website_summaries.verdict: For users looking for a shoe that’s ready for outdoor adventures and the casual, day-to-day walks, the Merrell Moab Rover is an excellent choice. It has a high-performance outsole that can withstand different ground conditions. At an affordable price, the shoe has plenty of benefits.
pros: It is durable, as per most purchasers
Users are provided with good stability
This shoe from Merrell has a lightweight mesh lining treated with M-Select FRESH which prevents odor and keeps the foot fresh
Some wearers have appreciated that the leather upper has a die-cut, rubber heel
The Merrell air cushion found in the heel enhances stability and absorbs shock, as a few buyers have noticed
A user is impressed because stones don’t get stuck on the sole of the Moab Rover
Several reviews have praised the Vibram tech on the outsole because of its slip-resistant properties
Most users are satisfied with the comfort brought by this model from the Moab series
A lot of reviewers use these kicks for everyday use
A handful of reviewers with high-arched feet like the arch support the shoe provides
cons: The shoes are coming apart after a few months, as mentioned by some buyers
A small number of online shoppers say that the shoe squeaks as they walk

customer_reviews.title: They rapidly become the pair of shoes that look like you've been working in the kitchen of a greasy ...
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that the external covering is suede. As such if you do a lot of walking then they become grubby and look awful. They rapidly become the pair of shoes that look like you've been working in the kitchen of a greasy spoon. That said the build quality is, as normal, great from Merrell and they feel as though they will last a good few months on someones feet. Not mine, as suede in a walking shoe, does not cut it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected because I ordered a size bigger than ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected because I ordered a size bigger than I normally wear as I learned from a pair of Moab walking shoes that Merill sizes are small.
customer_reviews.author: keith rand

customer_reviews.title: Great footwear
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Merrells. Just love them. Fit perfect, feel good. Can't wait to go for a long walk. Already looking to buy a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: terry hoare

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet
customer_reviews.text: Having large and wide feet, shoe shopping online can mean a few returns to find the right fit. This not not the case here. The Size 15 UK shoes were just right and don't pinch. Its still early days but after a few miles walked my feet are happy and no "new shoe" woes. They look nice and the tongue part is quite big and padded which helps make these fell great!
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Nice, runs smaller, good construction.
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful shoe by Merrell. Unfortunately, they run a half size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Nicholas  K

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes but a bit small I find Kerrell half size bigger when available a better fit
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable, have not used them in the rain but were good walking through long wet grass.
customer_reviews.author: Red-Kite

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Well made. I got the espresso colour is well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy, ordered a size up and they fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but run a little small
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes highly recommended but definitely get an Half size bigger if available. I bought my correct size and they are a little tight around the toes which can get a little uncomfortable after a long day at work
customer_reviews.author: Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet (and buy a size up)
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look OK but would not fit anyone with a wide foot, and you must select a half size up or full size up. I am normally a size 9, wide fitting (2E New Balance). I ordered 9.5 and they were a little snug on the length and too narrow. Seems like a Merrell thing. Won't be ordering Merrell again.
customer_reviews.author: highersights

customer_reviews.title: Quality was very good. Fit was perfect and delivery right on time
customer_reviews.text: Quality was very good. Fit was perfect and delivery right on time!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Bright

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: not bad for the price I paid, and time will tell how good or bad it is.As just had it a few days .
customer_reviews.author: cheng ki see

customer_reviews.title: good quality shoe as you would expect for a Merrell ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, good quality shoe as you would expect for a Merrell product but a very keen fit for the size that I wear.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Quality shoe at a good price. I ordered a size larger than my normal as I'd read these were small fitting. This ensured I got a good fitting fitting pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab Rover Low Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: These Moab Rover shoes from Merrell feature oily leather upper with die cut rubber heel for durability. Mesh lining treated with M Select fresh naturally prevents odour before it starts for fresh smelling feet. Merrell air cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability and compression moulded EVA foot frame provides cushioning. They also feature removable EVA foot bed and the outsole is made out of Vibram.
feature_bullets: Versatile Design Ideal for all Occasions
